section.title: Pre-Install Requirements and Prerequisites
section.para: Ensure that the following requirements have been met before proceeding with the install.

listitem.para: Once unzipped, the &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE binary release requires at least 300MB of free disk space. Keep in mind that disk space requirements may change as new releases become available.
The &THIS.PLATFORM; &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; platform will run on the same hardware as &JEE.PLATFORM;.

A working installation of the Java Development Kit (JDK) version 5 or higher is required in order to run the &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM;. Note that &JEE.PLATFORM; is runtime dependency, but comes bundled with the binary distribution.
For instructions on how to install the JDK, refer to .
&THIS.PLATFORM; &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; client side components use AJAX and CSS3, therefore the use of an up-to-date browser is recommended.

section.title: Install &THIS.PLATFORM; &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM;
section.para: The &THIS.PLATFORM; &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; is pre-installed in &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE binary release. The file slee-management-console.war is present in JBOSS_HOME/server/<node>/deploy/ directory.

section.title: Uninstalling &THIS.PLATFORM; &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM;
section.para: To uninstall &THIS.PLATFORM; &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; simply delete the slee-management-console.war file from JBOSS_HOME/server/<node>/deploy/ directory.

section.title: Building &THIS.PLATFORM; &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; from source
section.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; can be built from source by using Maven build tool as detailed below:

step.title: Downloading the source code

important.para: Subversion is used to manage its source code. Instructions for using Subversion, including install, can be found at

step.para: Use SVN to checkout a specific release source, the base URL is &THIS.RELEASE_SOURCE_CODE_URL;, then add the specific release version, eg: &THIS.VERSION;.
You can also download from the SVN trunk. However, the process is not stable and you might encounter difficulties getting it to build correctly. Here is how to proceed if you so desire:

step.title: Building the source code

important.para: Maven 2.0.9 (or higher) is used to build the release. Instructions for using Maven2, including install, can be found at
Make sure to have the JBOSS_HOME environment variable set and pointing to the desired &THIS.PLATFORM; installation.

step.para: Use Maven to build the binaries.
Once the process finishes you should have the slee-management-console.war file in the JBOSS_HOME/server/<node>/deploy/ directory.
